column4: Supposing that there's a rather essential set of libraries like libstdc++-5 that are completely missing from karmic's repositories but are needed to run a lot of older, closed-source software that worked in Jaunty, what would your recommendation be there?
speak to the maintainers to get them included ASAP
Good idea :> And how would you speak to the maintainer of a package that isn't maintained in karmic any longer?
speak to the maintainer and ask them to maintain it in karmic
I think you're missing the point just a little bit :P Thanks, but never mind
I'm not - if the packge doesn't exist, either speak to the old package maintaiers to bring it forward, or log a request for a new package to be created as a new project
I'd be surprised if the legacy libraries are removed though
Oh, I was surprised too of course, but that doesn't really change the fact that there's no libstdc++-5 package to be found in Synaptic
ahhh so there really isnt one, I thought  you where suggesting in theory
in that case contact the jaunty maintainer and ask them to bring it forward if possible
No, in "theory" they -should- be there :P In practice they're obliterated
didn't realise they had actually gone, sorry
You might do better to tell him the "right" way to do it rather than insult his intelligence? :>
I'm getting there, I'm not insulting his intelligence in the slightlyest
Incidentally slightlyest isn't even a word, but fair enough :P
fat finger problem
I wasn't aware there was a channel policy against "silly greetings?" What constitutes a silly greeting?
unessasarry noise is the policy
ask the orcale guys
check the bug report

i did, https://bugs.launchpad.net/indicator-application/+bug/625793...i was hoping that someone else may have found something, as it makes maverick unusable for anyone who types in a language besides english :>
nope, bug report is the best place to track it
let it go,
stop it
